abstract.para: This document defines version &version; of the XML Localization Interchange File Format (XLIFF). The purpose of this vocabulary is to store localizable data and carry it from one step of the localization process to the other, while allowing interoperability between and among tools.

section.title: The Modules Specifications
section.para: This section specifies the OPTIONAL Modules that MAY be used along with Core for advanced functionality.

appendix.title: Media Type Registration Template for XLIFF Version 2.0 and higher Versions
appendix.para: This Appendix content will be used to seek final media type registration for XLIFF Version &pversion; and higher Versions (including this XLIFF Version &version;).

appendix.title: Machine Readable Validation Artifacts
appendix.para:
This appendix summarizes information on machine readable validation artifacts for XLIFF Version &version;
XLIFF Core [XML Schema],
&this-loc;/schemas/xliff_core_&bschversion;.xsd
[XML Catalog] of XLIFF Defined XML Schemas,
&this-loc;/schemas/catalog.xml
XML Schemas of XLIFF Modules are referenced from those modules.
The basic grammar and structure of XLIFF &version; is defined using ten (10) XML Schemas and one (1) XML catalog. The module schemas are specifically referenced from their respective modules.

section.title: Support Schemas
section.para: Third party support schemas that are normatively referenced from this specification or from the machine readable artifacts that are a part of this multipart product are distributed along with the XLIFF-defined schemas in a subfolder named informativeCopiesOf3rdPartySchemas and further subdivided in folders according to the owner/maintainer of the schema.

warning.para: Schema copies in this sub-folder are provided solely for implementers convenience and are NOT a part of the OASIS multipart product. These schemas belong to their respective owners and their use is governed by their owners' respective IPR policies. The support schemas are organized in folders per owner/maintainer. It is the implementer's sole responsibility to ensure that their local copies of all schemas are the appropriate up to date versions.

section.para: Currently the only included third party support schema is http://www.w3.org/2001/xml.xsd [http://www.w3.org/2009/01/xml.xsd] at &this-loc;/schemas/informativeCopiesOf3rdPartySchemas/w3c/xml.xsd in this distribution.
